name: The Ueckers - "Rocket to Wrigley" CD
description:
***THESE WILL SHIP SOMETIME BEFORE MAY 31***

THE UECKERS  are not an oldies group, they are not a glitter group they don't play boogie music and they don't play blues. THE UECKERS are an original baseball punk band for 2013, and their songs are brief, to the point and every one a potential hit.

The duo consists of J. Uecker and B.Uecker.  The two guitarists, play with such force that their sound has been compared to a hundred howling howitzers going off. The two share singing responsibilities and the drummer's (yet to be named) pulsating playing launches the throbbing sound of the band.

THE UECKERS all originate from the north side of Chicago and kids who grew up there became musicians, degenerates or dentists. THE UECKERS are a little of each. Their sound is not unlike the sound of a fast drill on a rear molar.

With no budget, no cares and a constant soundtrack(and press release) lifted from THE RAMONES they show their undying love for baseball and punk rock with 14 blistering budget rock tunes that when paired with a cold Old Style will get you through the summer ahead.

GO CUBBIES!

K-N-U-C-K! IF YOU WANNA PLAY TODAY!

name: The Cry! and The Connection split 7"
description:
Free buttons with every order and other assorted Mooster goodies.

Mooster Records has teamed up with S-P Records in Japan to bring you The Cry and The Connection who bring two sides of rock n roll to this rockin' wax split! The Cry! from Portland Oregon bring you two smoldering tracks on their side starting off with the lamentful "Discotheque" and capping it off with a blistering rendition of The Boys' "T.C.P"! Might we have another "Alternative Chartbuster" on our hands? On the flip side are the kinds of songs that paved the way for the rock n roll that we love today. The Connection from Portsmouth, NH has a sound that takes all influences of rock n roll and swirls them around into a dance party that sounds like the Beatles, Ramones and Chesterfield Kings got together for a Sunday gig at CBGB's. The first track a cover of garage rock forefather's The Myddle Class' "Don't Let Me Sleep Too Long" shows you what we are working with right out of the gate. The second track is one of my personal favorite tracks called "She's Gonna Leave You" and already has reached a very wide audience with plays on "Little Steven's Underground Garage". Alot of rock n roll from both ends of the spectrum on one of the best 7"s that Mooster has released! 

Special U.S. only white vinyl and Japan only red vinyl!

name: The Demerits - "Shake It" 7"
description:
From the rubber chicken strewn streets of Berwyn, IL comes - The Demerits. A three piece rock-n-roll band where simple trashy guitar, driving bass & caveman drums are the foundation for the noise we make ... well, that and $5 bottles of wine & LaCrosse beer.

We've discovered that we write some pretty danceable garage-slop that oozes the likes of The Cramps, X, The Revillos, and The B-52's ... so if that's your kind of thing, you should come out - buy us a drink - and enjoy the show! And if it's not your thing, you should come out - buy us a drink - and leave ... don't worry, we won't hold it against you. 

TRACKS:

SIDE A: "SHAKE IT"
SIDE B: "IN A BAND"

name: Pool Party - "Pool Party Party" CD and 7"
description:
Pool Party and Mooster Records have been working sneaky style on something really special for you! It's Pool Party Party! This joint release was cooked up when Brandon flew down to Miami to celebrate the release of the Teenage Weirdo 7"... This new record (or extended CD) expands on the poppy slimy sexy drug addled creepiness that PP is infamous for!

These catchy jams about sex, voyeurism, animalism, near death overdoses, and other wholesome goodness were written for your entire family!

The vinyl was pressed by Pool Party's Doom Buggy records and is exxxclusively distributed by Mooster Records!

01 - Pool Party Party

02 - Coma Dose

03 - Raised by Wolves

04 - Teenage Weirdo

05 - Whatta They Know?!

06 - You Don't Know Shit

07 - Scissor Attack

08 - Secret Wife

09 - She Loves Dick

10 - Sperm Bank City, USA

11 - Evil Tonite

12 - Dancing

 

TRACKS 1,2,3,7,8 & 9 APPEAR ON THE 7" VERSION

TRACKS 4,5, & 11 ALSO APPEAR ON MR03 "TEENAGE WEIRDO" 7"

TRACKS 6, 10 & 12 ARE EXCLUSIVE TO THE CD!

options.name: Buy PPP and Teenage Weirdo 7" and get a FREE CD of PPP!

name: "Manic Recession" The Homewreckers/City Mouse split 7"
description:
"Manic Recession" the split 7" between New York's baddest queer punk band THE HOMEWRECKERS and Riverside, CA's soulful punk trio CITY MOUSE has been set with an OCTOBER 15th release date.

FIRST 100 ON TRANSLUCENT PINK VINYL!

If you missed the first 7"s from these bands, you have a month to catch up! Pickup the first HOMEWRECKERS 7" from KISS OF DEATH RECORDS now and the first CITY MOUSE 7" from IT'S ALIVE RECORDS or you should definitely download them from the band's Bandcamp pages. 

So, here are the plans for pre-orders: You will get a limited, exclusive to MOOSTER RECORDS translucent pink vinyl color of the 7" and some other secret goodies. 

Also be sure to "like" our facebook page and follow us on twitter if you don't already, and keep checking back here every couple of weeks for more details on this and other upcoming releases.

More info on this release: THE HOMEWRECKERS dropped us two smoking tracks of gritty pop-punk/rock n roll glory dealing with the topic of depression and the shit that everybody goes through. Front-woman CRISTY ROAD lends not only her amazing artwork to the front cover but also her gut wrenching howl to the lead vocals on both tracks.

On the flip side, we have CITY MOUSE and their front lady MISKI DEE throwin down two amazingly soulful, powerful and heartfelt never before released tracks of west coast pop punk the way it used to be made. Joe Queer loves it and so will you!!! 

Make sure to get your orders in early to secure a translucent pink copy.  LIMITED TO 100 COPIES!!!!


****THESE WILL SHIP ON OR AROUND OCTOBER 15TH***
